Dispute_Type: Whether the IAD applied the correct test to determine if the Applicant's wife was a member of the family class
Legal_Issue: Application of the correct legal test for genuine marriage under immigration regulations
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, section 4
Procedural_Context: Judicial review under the Federal Court Act
Credibility_Assessment: Contradictions in the Applicant's and his wife's testimonies
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, lack of supporting evidence for genuine marriage
Legal_Provision: Section 4 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage not genuine, entered into primarily for immigration purposes
Evaluation_Standard: Assessment of genuineness of marriage under new regulations
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible evidence of a genuine marital relationship
Decision_Maker: Designated Immigration Officer, Immigration Appeal Division (IAD)
Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, s. 4
Assessment_Standard: Whether the marriage was genuine or primarily for immigration purposes
Legal_Standard: Test for genuine spousal relationship under section 4 of IRPR
Application_Factor: Removal of requirement to assess intent to reside permanently together under new regulations
Decision_Outcome: Wife not considered a member of the family class
Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness of the legal test applied by IAD
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Cause_of_Refusal: Marriage not genuine, intended primarily to obtain immigration status
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 4, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence of a genuine marriage, contradictory testimonies
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistent statements by the Applicant and his wife
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to the IAD's application of the legal test
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
